title:
Parallel Distributional Deep Reinforcement Learning for Mapless
  Navigation of Terrestrial Mobile Robots
authors:
Victor Augusto Kich, Alisson Henrique Kolling, Junior Costa de Jesus,
  Gabriel V. Heisler, Hiago Jacobs, Jair Augusto Bottega, Andr\'e L. da S.
  Kelbouscas, Akihisa Ohya, Ricardo Bedin Grando, Paulo Lilles Jorge Drews-Jr,
  Daniel Fernando Tello Gamarra
abstract:
This paper introduces novel deep reinforcement learning (Deep-RL) techniques
using parallel distributional actor-critic networks for navigating terrestrial
mobile robots. Our approaches use laser range findings, relative distance, and
angle to the target to guide the robot. We trained agents in the Gazebo
simulator and deployed them in real scenarios. Results show that parallel
distributional Deep-RL algorithms enhance decision-making and outperform
non-distributional and behavior-based approaches in navigation and spatial
generalization.
